meanings.definition: To decide or rule upon as a judge or court.
meanings.sent1: The judge will adjudge the winner of the competition.
meanings.sent2: The court will adjudge the case based on the evidence presented.
meanings.sent3: It was comical to see the cat adjudge itself as the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to adjudge the truth in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will adjudge the best project in the class.

meanings.sent1: The official will adjudge the results of the election.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony will adjudge them as husband and wife.
meanings.sent3: The parrot adjudge the new word with a squawk.
meanings.sent4: The sunset seemed to adjudge the end of a perfect day.
meanings.sent5: The principal will adjudge the student of the month.
